decision_conditions: The Norway Maple (T11) is situated in the rear garden of the property in the far south east corner of the property, next to the boundary. The tree is prominent in the local landscape and has a moderate amenity value. The Beech (T13) is also located at the far end of the rear garden and is next to the western boundary. It has a moderate amenity value. Both of these trees have a good natural appearance.

The reasons given are not viewed as justified reasons for carrying out this level of pruning. It would unnecessarily introduce large pruning wounds to this mature Norway Maple which would likely lead to infection and would also significantly affect the natural appearance and structure of the crown. Therefore, the proposed work would reduce the size and amenity value of this tree.

The proposed pruning works on the Beech (T13)  are considered to be too drastic and will also unnecessarily introduce large pruning wounds - increasing the risk of infection. Removal of these branches would als
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: Heavily reduce front stem overhanging garden to first major union by approximately 5m and reduce remaining crown by 2-3m to suitable points on one Norway Maple (T11 on TPO 564) to remove two lowest limbs on one Beech (T13 on TPO 564).
